etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From quinov- + -ose, after German Chinovose

definitions: A methyl pentose sugar which was first obtained by hydrolysis of quinovite and is widespread in plants, especially as sulphate derivatives.

notes.text: Quinovose is a 6-deoxy derivative of glucose, C₆H₁₂O₅.
